messages.subject: Re: [SHQ] Aku Soku Zan?
messages.msgSnippet: Hi, If you really have seen the word on any historical records, will you post the source on this forum? http://forums.samurai-archives.com/viewtopic.php?t=1362
messages.messageBody:
Hi,
If you really have seen the word on any historical records, will you post
the source on this forum?
http://forums.samurai-archives.com/viewtopic.php?t=1362

I am Japanese and have read lots of Shinsengumi books but never seen such a
word.

Thanks
shikisoku




2007/2/22, Bunny ^_^ <shenlong71328@...>:
>
> My memory is always rather groggy, but I do believe I had read somewhere
> that the whole Aku Soku Zen was more of inside thing for the men of the
> Shinsengumi. Kinnda like you and your friends have your own inside jokes and
> things that only you guys would understand. I don't believe it was a
> propoganda tool... although, at that time, it really would have made a great
> propoganda line.
>
> k kobayakawa <kobaya635@... <kobaya635%40gmail.com>> wrote:
> >historically, it was used by more than just
> >Saitou Hajime, correct?
>
> It is from comic book "Rurouni Kenshin", isn't it?
> I don't think it's a historical fact.
>

messages.subject: Re: [SHQ] Aku Soku Zan?
messages.msgSnippet: My memory is always rather groggy, but I do believe I had read somewhere that the whole Aku Soku Zen was more of inside thing for the men of the Shinsengumi.
messages.messageBody:
My memory is always rather groggy, but I do believe I had read somewhere that the whole Aku Soku Zen was more of inside thing for the men of the Shinsengumi. Kinnda like you and your friends have your own inside jokes and things that only you guys would understand. I don't believe it was a propoganda tool... although, at that time, it really would have made a great propoganda line.

k kobayakawa <kobaya635@...> wrote: >historically, it was used by more than just
>Saitou Hajime, correct?

It is from comic book "Rurouni Kenshin", isn't it?
I don't think it's a historical fact.

I don't think it's a historical fact.

messages.subject: RE: [SHQ] Aku Soku Zan?
messages.msgSnippet: I was wondering this too. I like the expression so much I tattooed it on my back. _____ From: SHQ@yahoogroups.com [mailto:SHQ@yahoogroups.com] On Behalf Of
messages.messageBody:
I was wondering this too.

I like the expression so much I tattooed it on my back.



_____

From: SHQ@yahoogroups.com [mailto:SHQ@yahoogroups.com] On Behalf Of
tatchan1024
Sent: Monday, January 29, 2007 1:50 PM
To: SHQ@yahoogroups.com
Subject: [SHQ] Aku Soku Zan?



Hi Hi,

I'm sure most if not all of us are familiar with the expression "Aku
Soku Zan." My question is: historically, it was used by more than just
Saitou Hajime, correct? Who else was it used by?

Tatsuko

messages.subject: Aku Soku Zan?
messages.msgSnippet: Hi Hi, I m sure most if not all of us are familiar with the expression Aku Soku Zan. My question is: historically, it was used by more than just Saitou
messages.messageBody:
Hi Hi,

I'm sure most if not all of us are familiar with the expression "Aku
Soku Zan." My question is: historically, it was used by more than just
Saitou Hajime, correct? Who else was it used by?

Tatsuko
